results.title: Reflections of the Czech Republic
results.creator_credit: Karel Zauld and Czech Tourist Authority
results.brief_description: Set to a musical track and featuring no dialogue, this short film from the Czech Tourist Authority presents a montage of images depicting people at work and play in the Czech Republic; the culture, music, arts, natural wonders and traditional ceremonies of the area, creating a visual postcard of the region.

results.title: Redex round Australia car trials: 1953, 1954, 1955
results.creator_credit: Sally Jackson and Screen Sound Australia
results.brief_description: Screen Sound Australia uses newsreels and home movie footage, photographs, newspapers and interviews to present a detailed account of the world famous Redex trials held in Australia between 1953 and 1955. Over a distance of 6,500 miles, competitors drove standard passenger vehicles on a designated route around the eastern half of Australia. Rather than being a race, competitors were required to complete every segment in a fixed time, losing points if they arrived at any destination a minute early or late. We see the thrills and spills of the races as well as the cunning and ingenuity of the drivers who maneuvered their cars along dusty and hazardous outback routes where there was no access to motels, petrol stations, or even roads.
results.description: Screen Sound Australia uses newsreels and home movie footage, photographs, newspapers and interviews to present a detailed account of the world famous Redex trials held in Australia between 1953 and 1955. results.title: Red stone dancer: Henri Gaudier Brzeska
results.brief_description: A study of one of Gaudier-Brzeska’s most important sculptures, seen in different aspects of movement and light. The structure of the film is based on the characteristics found in a roll of film offcuts: random rhythms, interrupted movements, repeated movements, and the image relationships created by those movements and the static shots. Electronic sound track devised by Arthur Cantrill.

results.title: Red poll
results.brief_description: The Red Poll breed of cattle, which originated in East Anglia, England, is enjoying an increasing popularity throughout the world. It is a dual-purpose breed, providing milk and beef combined. The film explains to farmers the breed’s main characteristics and its advantages.

results.title: Red ball express
results.brief_description: To the music of “Orange Blossom Special” a train changes shape and colour. The impressionistic animation is drawn directly onto the film. Music played by Cecil Creasey.

results.title: Recycling
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Environmental Protection Agency
results.brief_description: Shows existing techniques for recovering materials from solid waste and describes the newly developed equipment and systems which may make recycling a universal project in the future. The pressure of public opinion in favour of recycling is enormous, nevertheless it is actually practised very little.

results.title: Recovering from a coronary
results.creator_credit: Frank Milton, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a practical rehabilitation program for patients with coronary heart disease (devised at Otago University Medical School and the New Zealand School of Physiotherapy) which has produced encouraging results. Although intended mainly for medical audiences, the film offers advice which would well help to avoid or delay the premature onset of coronary heart disease in the population as a whole.
